alert.note: Alert for Val Verde (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 03 at 1:45PM CDT until April 04 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS EXPECTED OVER VAL VERDE COUNTY ON TUESDAY AFTERNOON, AND MOST OF SOUTH-CENTRAL TEXAS WEDNESDAY MORNING AND AFTERNOON... Very dry air will filter into portions of the southern Edwards Plateau tomorrow afternoon, with values in the single digits and teens currently forecast. Combined with winds approaching and exceeding 20 MPH and dry to critically dry fuels, this will lead to critical fire weather conditions across Val Verde County on Tuesday afternoon. A Red Flag Warning has been issued, effective from 1-7 PM CDT. A cold front will push in from the northwest Tuesday night and early Wednesday morning. Very dry air will overspread the region behind the boundary, with widespread relative humidities in the teens and single digits forecast along and west of Interstate 35. Combined with sustained north winds ranging from 15 to 25 MPH, and dry to critically dry fuels, this will promote additional critical fire weather conditions across this portion of South- Central Texas. A Fire Weather Watch has been issued for all counties along and west of I-35, effective from 4 AM to 4 PM CDT Wednesday. Individuals are strongly encouraged to avoid any activities that could inadvertently promote the ignition and spread of wildfires on both Tuesday and Wednesday. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 7 PM CDT TUESDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR VAL VERDE COUNTY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR VAL VERDE COUNTY... The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 1 PM to 7 PM CDT Tuesday. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued. This Fire Weather Watch for wind and low relative humidity is in effect from late Tuesday night through Wednesday afternoon. * WINDS...Northwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 5 percent. * IMPACTS...
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
